title: settings
description: JSON schema for the configuration of safety-outlier-explorer
overview:
The most straightforward way to customize the Safety Outlier Explorer is by using a configuration object whose properties describe the behavior and appearance of the chart. Since the Safety Outlier Explorer is a Webcharts `chart` object, many default Webcharts settings are set in the [defaultSettings.js file](https://github.com/RhoInc/safety-outlier-explorer/blob/master/src/defaultSettings.js) as [described below](#Webcharts-Settings). Refer to the [Webcharts documentation](https://github.com/RhoInc/Webcharts/wiki/Chart-Configuration) for more details on these settings.
In addition to the standard Webcharts settings several custom settings not available in the base Webcharts library have been added to the Safety Outlier Explorer to facilitate data mapping and other custom functionality. These custom settings are described in detail below. All defaults can be overwritten by users.

start_value.title: Initially Displayed Measure
start_value.description: value of measure to display initially

filters.title: Filters
filters.description: an array of filter variables and associated metadata

details.title: Participant details
details.description: an array of ID-level variables and associated metadata

multiples_sizing.title: Dimensions of small multiples
multiples_sizing.description: width and height of small multiples

visits_without_data.title: Display visits without data?
visits_without_data.description: controls display of visits without data for the current measure

unscheduled_visit_pattern.title: Unscheduled Visit Pattern
unscheduled_visit_pattern.description: a regular expression that identifies unscheduled visits

unscheduled_visits_values.title: Unscheduled Visit List
unscheduled_visits_values.description: an array of strings that identify unscheduled visits; overrides unscheduled_visit_pattern
